articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck the northern foothills of the Himalayas near one of Tibet's holiest cities on Tuesday, damaging buildings around Shigatse and sending people running into the streets in neighbouring Nepal and India.
articles.title: Powerful earthquake hits holy city in China's Tibet

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jean-Marie Le Pen, founder of the far-right National Front party who tapped into working class concerns over immigration and globalisation, shaking up the French political establishment, has died, sources close to his daughter Marine Le Pen said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Former French far-right leader Jean-Marie Le Pen dies aged 96

articles.author: James Mackenzie, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas stood by its demand on Tuesday that Israel fully end its assault on Gaza under any deal to release hostages, and said U.S. President-elect Donald Trump was rash to say there would be "hell to pay" unless they go free by his Jan. 20 inauguration.
articles.title: Hamas stands by demand for end to Gaza war under hostage deal, as Trump deadline approaches

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: The United Arab Emirates has discussed with Israel and the United States participating in a provisional administration of post-war Gaza until a reformed Palestinian Authority is able to take charge, according to people familiar with the talks.
articles.title: Exclusive: UAE in talks with US, Israel about provisional government for post-war Gaza

articles.author: Stine Jacobsen, Jacob Gronholt-Pedersen
articles.description: Donald Trump Jr. is expected to visit Greenland on Tuesday, after his father, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, again expressed interest in gaining control over the vast Arctic island.
articles.title: Trump Jr. set to visit Greenland after his father reiterates interest in the island

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Austrian far-right Freedom Party (FPO) leader Herbert Kickl confirmed on Tuesday he plans to invite the conservative People's Party (OVP) to hold coalition talks after he was tasked with forming a coalition government.
articles.title: Austrian far-right leader to invite conservatives to hold coalition talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Finnish police said on Tuesday they have recovered a lost anchor from the bottom of the ocean as part of an investigation of suspected sabotage against power and internet cables in the Baltic Sea.
articles.title: Finland recovers anchor from seabed in Baltic Sea cables investigation

articles.author: Maxwell Adombila
articles.description: John Dramani Mahama was sworn in for a second term as Ghana's president on Tuesday at a ceremony in the capital Accra, pledging to overcome public discontent by boosting the economy and creating much-needed jobs.
articles.title: Ghana’s Mahama returns as president, vowing to boost economy

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: Behind rows of barbed wire and a small army of personal security, impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol remained holed up in his sprawling hillside villa with his wife, dogs and cats on Tuesday as investigators planned his arrest.
articles.title: South Korea's impeached leader Yoon hunkers down in Seoul's 'Beverly Hills'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syria will take its time to organise a landmark national dialogue conference to ensure that the preparations include all segments of Syrian society, Foreign Minister Asaad al-Shibani said on Tuesday, according to state media.
articles.title: Syria to take time organising national dialogue, foreign minister says
